title: Neil Wagner and Trent Boult bowl New Zealand to series win
content: In the end, this was much like the very first Test match between these two sides, back in December 2001. Then, like now, rain washed away the first two days. And now, like then, New Zealand found a way to win regardless, by an innings to boot. New Zealand began day five needing seven wickets, with Bangladesh trailing by 141. It only took the hosts one session, albeit one extended at both ends, to complete the job, with their left-arm quicks Neil Wagner and Trent Boult leading the way.
